poem:
Title: "Of Shadows and Men"

Hoary Kremlin-crows
In midnight whispers sow discord's seed.
Baltic frost bears the weight of secrets,
A Tartu scholar silenced in the icy reeds.
Academic bonds snapped before justice credence bleeds,
And yet, in this grim dance of estranged comrades,
Is it truth, or puppetry in the theatre of deeds?
Scholar or spy, we tread humanity's high-wire needs.
